conclusion: Determine the initial conditions and acceleration during the first phase.
Given data: Mass of the missile m = 100 kg, Acceleration a = 10g = 10 x 10 m/s^2 = 100 m/s^2, Initial height h = 20000 m, Height reached with uniform acceleration h1 = 5000 m
The missile accelerates vertically upward from rest.
Using the kinematic equation for uniformly accelerated motion: v1^2 = u^2 + 2ah1
Where v1 is the velocity after reaching h1, u is the initial velocity (0 m/s since it starts from rest).
Substituting the values, v1^2 = 0 + 2 x 100 x 5000, v1^2 = 1000000, v1 = sqrt(1000000) = 1000 m/s
This gives the velocity of the missile when it reaches an altitude of 5000 meters.
Determine the thrust force of the rocket engine.
Using Newton's second law: F - mg = ma
Where F is the thrust force, g is the acceleration due to gravity (10 m/s²).
Substituting the values, F - 100 x 10 = 100 x 100, F - 1000 = 10000, F = 11000 N
Determine the components of the thrust force during the second phase.
The angle θ between the jet direction and the vertical direction is given by: cos θ = 1/11
The horizontal and vertical components of the thrust are: Fx = F sin θ = 11000 x sqrt(120)/11 = 1000 sqrt(120) N, Fy = F cos θ = 11000 x 1/11 = 1000 N
Determine the net forces in the horizontal and vertical directions.
Horizontal direction: ax = Fx/m = 1000 sqrt(120)/100 = 10 sqrt(120) m/s^2
The magnitudes of the horizontal and vertical accelerations are: 10 sqrt(120) m/s^2 and 0 m/s^2
